textList.name: TEXT_RUINS
textList.text: In front of you lays a massive monolith structure on the surface of a moon. The exterior is entirely black, with a few dim lights here and there. Maybe it holds something of value?
A half cubical ship, split straight down the middle, has crash landed on the nearby lava planet. Though the conditions are hazardous, there might be something of worth remaining.
Before you lies ruins unlike anything you've ever seen. Entirely black and cubical, the skeletons of a few massive warships remain at this beacon. Maybe you can salvage something here?

A humongous cubical mega-structure lies in your wake, transmitting a short but undecipherable message. Surely if this thing still has enough power to send a message, maybe it has something worth taking?

You appear to be witnessing the aftermath of a terribly damaged and brutally torn apart mega-class carrier ship, larger than your cruiser or even the Federation's largest fleet ships. Even stranger, the wreck is entirely black and cubical. Maybe it contains something worth salvaging?

The remains of a couple strange looking Auto-ships, certainly not of Rebel design though similar in tech according to scans, are scattered around the remains of a massive cubical cruiser. Maybe there's more tech aboard the ship?

The wreck of a dated and foreign vessel is being pelted by a small and thinly dispersed asteroid field. Though the asteroids have clearly caused some damage, the storm has mostly passed by, and won't be an issue for much longer. Maybe something of value is left behind?

textList.name: TEXT_RUINS_TRANSLATE
textList.text: "The nebulas are our next goal. Supplies are thin, but there are tales that the phantoms hoard unspeakable treasures in the clouds. They are mighty, prolific in population size, and a very proud people. But not even the proudest of beings shan't yield to our weapons. Hear me, the Dynasty will have met no match as relentless as ourselves. The days of peace between our kinds are over. The war demands of it."

"We do not know where they came from. Queen Y told us that we were divine. That we were the masters of reality. Yet, the newcomers... they claim they come from beyond, through a tunnel. They call it the [word unknown]. The engineers made no mention of such a place. They speak such strange words. Dreams of gods? A living universe? I see a great threat in them, but the Royals say they will not hurt us. Some kind of pact, a gift of the outskirts in return for peace. I do not foresee good in this, but it is not my decision to be made."

"I encountered one of the metalloids the other day. In broken dialect it asked me if I could spare it ammunition. To arm himself against my crew, I thought? Nay, he merely scrambled it down his throat, gave a garbled thanks, and drifted away. I sometimes question the origins of them. I would study them, see what makes them tick, but I can never get close enough to capture one before they slip away. It is infuriating. I have never known such failure."

"The crystalline, the attendant whom I was given by the Royal appointment, tells me strange stories of life in his world. What a simple creature. Why do the Royals painstake us to endure with these mortal beings? They birth, they age, they die. We do not. Even the Commonwealth does not toil in such fashion as them. Perhaps they are glad to have been spared? The phantoms knew no such luck. I hope to dispose of him soon. Perhaps the appointment will grant me a servant who speaks less next time."

"Nine months I have served aboard this vessel for Ambassador L. It is insufferable. Life in the slums of the Commonwealth, as grueling as it were, was more pleasant than this. I am treated like... like a crystalline! A mortal! The Royals have forgotten that we too are [word unknown]. I will not stand for this. Tomorrow, I will overthrow the Ambassador. I will leave this place! The Commonwealth will rise, it will prosper! I just know it!"

"They say the war is going well. I am not so certain. There are rumors, very concerning rumors, of a genocidal plot by the Royals. They talk so often of the Commonwealth, the gears of war. I am afraid they may be the next target. Yes, it will be the enemy. But... the enemy is us. If they are truly parallel to ourselves, should we not expect equal retaliation? I fear the worst."

"I heard a strange story the other day. They say that the crystalline emperor, Ycathine, had a feud with Queen Y. Stranger yet, he left the palace. Alive. Unheard of... no mortal has ever challenged the Royals and lived! What are we coming to? Have we lost our dignity, to allow ourselves to be spit upon by repugnant beings? In my outrage I slaughtered the last of my servants. It is a small demonstration, but it is a fitting one."

"War with the Dynasty was a mistake. Not that I fear we will lose. Nay. It is just that... they are so numerous. We were aware of this fact, but not of the severity of it. Our victory is certain, but when will it be? We are running out of time. The Royals continue to lie, they say the war is going spectacularly. But if we keep distracting ourselves with petty squabbles, soon even their tone may shift. They say the Reaper never yields. I did not believe it when I heard it. But, there is too much evidence now for it not to be true."

"While exploring the other day I came across a remarkable system. A beautiful world populated by strange creatures. With almost no landmasses, the oceans stretched so far I feel as though they could engulf all of [word unknown]. The primitive species here will not bother us. They may even provide great entertainment. I think I shall build a resort here. The Royals are always looking for new ways to spend their leisure."

"The Monolith looks well. It is a marvelous work of art, and to think inside sits [word unknown]! There are few habitable systems around it, but those that are, I wonder if some day they will birth life capable of appreciating the Monolith's beauty. Should the war go south, should there be left no other trace of us, at least the Monolith shall stand proud as an eternal grace of our perfection!"

event.name: RUINS_SALVAGE
event.text: With the ship now out of the way you're free to inspect the ruins.

choice.text: (Anointed) Translate the words on the ruins.

event.text: "Will trying my best. Words of forefathers rusty in mind, but gist I am getting right. Stand back."

choice.text: (Runic Translator) Translate the words on the ruins.

event.text: Your translator does its best to decipher the lengthy runes scribbled across the walls of the gargantuan ruins. The output, fortunately, is legible, though you can't say for certain its accuracy.

choice.text: (Obelisk Crew) Translate the words on the ruins.
(Cognitive Crew) Translate the words on the ruins.

event.text: Unfortunately, the ruins don't contain anything exciting. Any tech has been dismantled, so you content yourself with taking some resources that were left behind.

The ruins only contain a single weapon crate left behind, but to your disappointment it appears to have belonged to some pirate who stashed it here to hide. It might not be ancient tech, but it's still a free weapon.

You don't find any weapons or drones, but you do find a damaged combustion engine in there that resembles a modern engine system in some capacity. You strip it for parts, intended to upgrade yours with what remains.
Alas, the ruins yield no military weaponry. You do however discover an incredibly advanced generator. With these parts, maybe you can improve your own!

While salvaging the ruins, you find a strange triangular drone. With some tinkering, you even get it to function for a short while. You run some scans and construct a schematic to bring back to the ship.

While exploring the ruins, you nearly mistake a drone for a statue before you recognize a dim glow from its lights. A cylindrical design with 2 rings, the drone appears to be designed to interface with a system to manage it. You construct a schematic using some scans and bring it back to the ship.

You're amazed to find an armory inside the structure, but unfortunately most of the weapons inside are completely dysfunctional. You do however find a Laser of some sort that you bring back to the ship.
A still functional Bomb launcher, similar to modern ones yet very old, is laying in a central chamber in the structure. You bring it back to the ship.

event.text: An automated vessel is scanning the wreckage. There's no way you can access whatever the structure holds without first taking care of the ship.

Your Engineer struggles to shut down the Auto, but they do manage to change its primary directive to fleeing the beacon, leaving you alone with the ruins.
Whatever the ruins have to offer isn't worth the effort.

event.name: RUINS_TRAP

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: This is the location of a ruin.
beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: In front of your ship is a massive cubical cruiser, its exterior covered in small green lights. Though the ship is completely unmoving, the dim glow from the lights suggests there must still be some form of power aboard.
It's very possible the ship might contain something of value, but you can't guarantee it. Do you want to send a team aboard?
Your crew find the interior of the ship void of oxygen, and scans show no life support has ever been installed on the ship. How do we proceed?

choice.text: (Anaerobic Crew) Send in the anaerobic crew.
(Orchid Crew) No breaches detected, the Orchid should be able to provide oxygen.
We have nothing to proceed with.

event.text: Unfortunately, you have no choice but to pull away from the cruiser.
Whatever the ruins have to offer isn't worth the effort.

event.name: RUINS_TRAP_CONTINUE
event.text: As soon as you are inside, the crew find themselves in a large antechamber, decorated with various artifacts you don't recognize, resting on what appear to be pressure sensors. You could probably grab one of them, but you don't know what will happen, if anything.

choice.text: There's a weapon here, grab it!

event.text: You grab the weapon, and as soon as you lift it from its pedestal an alarm sounds in the ship. An atom shaped drone comes out of the walls, weapons primed and firing down at your crew!
Your crew run back to the ship, pursued by the drone. You try to seal the airlocks quickly, but unfortunately the drone make it aboard. Get ready to defend the ship!
Fortunately, you're able to teleport back all of the crew in time. The drone is left behind on the ship as you pull away.

event.name: RUINS_STAR

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: This is the location of a ruin.
beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: A massive cubical structure, possibly a station, is caught in the gravitational pull of the nearby star, and is slowly pulling closer. Though the inevitable destruction of the station cannot be avoided, there might be enough time to salvage whatever might be aboard.
As you approach, it becomes clear the environment is too hazardous to go through with this without taking a hit. You're going to have to bear a solar flare or two, unless you have the right defenses.

choice.text: Continue, we can take a hit.
(Adv. Shields) Our shields will protect us.

event.text: Whatever the ruins have to offer isn't worth the effort.

choice.text: "WARNING: hazardous conditions detected. Investigating without further preparations: unadvised."

event.text: Whatever the ruins have to offer isn't worth the effort.

event.name: RUINS_STAR_PROCEED
event.text: A solar flare rocks your ship, starting a fire. Still, you press forward and dock with the station. With the timer ticking, your crew explore the interior. They find what appears to be a crew drone of sorts, but an inferno has consumed the room!

choice.text: Grab the drone and get out!

event.text: Your crew grab the drone, pulling it back, but it's a lot heavier than expected. Working together, they manage to drag it out of the fire, but another solar flare passes by, rocking the hull once again. Most of your crew make it back to the ship, but one of them trips, dropping the drone. Scans show the star is flaring up again, and you only have time to save one of them!
You leave your crew for dead, taking the drone and head back to the ship. You manage to pull away before the flare hits, but the wreck takes it full blast and is torn in half!

removeCrew.text: Fortunately, the Clone Bay revives your crew. You can tell they're mad about the situation, but they'll get over it soon enough.

event.text: You leave the drone, dragging your crew back to the ship and pulling away before the flare hits. The wreck takes it full blast and is torn in half, undoubtedly destroying the drone with it too.

choice.text: Save both but risk some more damage.

event.text: You pull the ship closer, taking the force of another solar flare. Luckily, you're still able to save both your crew and drone and fly away.
Thanks to your teleporter, you're able to beam up both your crew and the drone before another solar flare hits.
